member.name: T:P4API.P4ExceptionLevels
member.summary: Defines the exception levels available in P4Connection.

member.name: F:P4API.P4ExceptionLevels.NoExceptionOnWarnings
member.summary: Exceptions will only be thrown when Perforce has errors. This is the default exception level.

member.name: F:P4API.P4ExceptionLevels.NoExceptionOnErrors
member.summary: Exceptions will never be thrown when Perforce has errors.

member.name: F:P4API.P4ExceptionLevels.ExceptionOnBothErrorsAndWarnings
member.summary: Exceptions will be thrown for both Errors and Warnings.

member.name: T:P4API.P4BaseRecordSet
member.summary: Base functionality for P4Recordset and P4UnParsedRecordset.
member.remarks: This is a base class for internal use. Do not use directly.

member.name: M:P4API.P4BaseRecordSet.HasErrors
member.summary: Checks the Recordset to determine if errors occured.
member.returns: True if the p4 command returned errors.
member.remarks: This is the same as testing Errors.Count.

member.name: M:P4API.P4BaseRecordSet.HasWarnings
member.summary: Checks the Recordset to determine if warnings occured.
member.remarks: This is the same as testing Warnings.Count.
member.returns: True if the p4 command returned warnings.

member.name: P:P4API.P4BaseRecordSet.Errors
member.summary: Gets an array of error messages returned from the Perforce command.
member.remarks: These are the error messages that are returned from Perforce.

member.name: P:P4API.P4BaseRecordSet.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets an error messages returned from the Perforce command.
member.remarks: Errors are concatanated to one string, seperated by new lines.

member.name: P:P4API.P4BaseRecordSet.Warnings
member.summary: Gets an array of warning messages returned from the Perforce command.
member.remarks: These are the warning messages that are returned from Perforce.
member.note: Perforce is not always intuitive in how it defines warnings vs. messages. Always test various scenarios to determine whether the output is a warning or message.
member.value: Array of warnings returned from Perforce.

member.name: T:P4API.OnPromptEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate to handle the OnPrompt event.
member.remarks:
Handle Perforce "prompts". Prompts are from commands that ask the user to respond, such as:
login
passwd
resolve (without an -a* switch)

member.name: T:P4API.P4Connection
member.summary: A connection to a Perforce server instance.

remarks.p: The P4Connection class is the main player in P4.Net. This represents a connection to the Perforce server. Every utility that uses P4.Net will have some variation of the following code:

Rule number 1: Always remember to disconnect. This frees unmanaged memory, and cleanly disconnects from the Perforce server. P4Connection implements IDisposable, and the Dispose and Disconnect methods can be used interchangeably.

P4.Net is based off the command-line syntax (as are most other Perforce APIs). Almost all of the commands you issue in P4.Net will use the same arguments as the p4 client executable. For example, say you need to find the latest submitted changelist under a given path (//depot/path).

If you don’t know what all the arguments for p4 changes mean, then p4 help changes is your best friend. The first step in building anything with P4.Net, is to know the exact command lines you’d run manually.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.ConvertDate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts Perforce date (integer) to .Net DateTime.
member.remarks: The Perforce API returns most dates as an integer representing the number of seconds since 1/1/1970 in UTC. The command line client generally returns dates as strings in the Perforce server's time zone. The ConvertDate methods use the client's time zone for the offset.
member.returns: DateTime in .Net format.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.ConvertDate(System.String)
member.summary: Converts Perforce date (integer value as a string) to .Net DateTime.
member.remarks: The Perforce API returns most dates as an integer representing the number of seconds since 1/1/1970 in UTC. The command line client generally returns dates as strings in the Perforce server's time zone. The ConvertDate methods use the client's time zone for the offset.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.ConvertDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts .Net DateTime to Perforce date (integer).
member.remarks: The Perforce API returns most dates as an integer representing the number of seconds since 1/1/1970 in UTC. The command line client generally returns dates as strings in the Perforce server's time zone. The ConvertDate methods use the client's time zone for the offset.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.IsServerCaseSensitive
member.summary: Checks the case-sensitivity of the Perforce server.
member.returns: True when the connected server is case-sensitive.
member.remarks: This must be called after connecting to the server.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Connect
member.summary: Connect to the Perforce server

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect from the Perforce Server

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Login(System.String)
member.summary: Login to the Perforce Server

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.CreatePendingChangelist(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new pending changelist.
member.returns: P4PendingChangelist object representing the named pending changelist

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.IsValidConnection(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if the Perforce connection is valid.
member.param: if set to true it will check if the user is logged in.
if set to true it will verify the client exists.
member.returns: true if the connection is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
IsValidConnection performs the following 3 checks (depending on the arguments passed).
Runs p4 info, and verifies the server is valid.
If checkClient is true, verifies that p4 info returns a clientName that is not "*unknown*.
If checkLogin is true, verifies that p4 login -s does not have errors.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Run(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Executes a Perforce command in tagged mode.
member.param: The arguments to the Perforce command. Remember to use a dash (-) in front of all switches
member.returns: A P4Recordset containing the results of the command.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.RunUnParsed(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Executes a Perforce command in non-tagged mode.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Parse_Form(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Parse the raw text of a Perforce form into a P4Form object
member.param: Raw contents of the form spec.
member.returns: A P4Form object. The fields of the form can be read or updated. If you update a filed, you can save it with Save_Form.
member.remarks:
Forms are the things that pop-up in an editor when run from a command line. In P4.Net (and most other Perforce APIs), you do not need to parse/format the text manually. Instead, you can get/set the fields using the Fields and ArrayFields collections.
The following is a list of common form commands:
client
branch
label
job
user
group
protect
triggers
branch
When fetching or saving a form, do not use the '-o' and '-i' flags. P4.Net will automatically include them.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Fetch_Form(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Fetch a form object from Perforce.
member.returns: A Form object. The fields of the form can be read or updated. If you update a filed, you can save it with Save_Form.
member.remarks:
Forms are the things that pop-up in an editor when run from a command line. In P4.Net (and most other Perforce APIs), you do not need to parse/format the text manually. Instead, you can get/set the fields using the Fields and ArrayFields collections.
The following is a list of common form commands:
client
branch
label
job
user
group
protect
triggers
branch
When fetching or saving a form, do not use the '-o' and '-i' flags. P4.Net will automatically include them.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Save_Form(P4API.P4Form)
member.summary: Saves the form to Perforce.
member.param: The P4Form object retrieved from Fetch_Form.
member.remarks:
Forms are the things that pop-up in an editor when run from a command line. In P4.Net (and most other Perforce APIs), you do not need to parse/format the text manually. Instead, you can get/set the fields using the Fields and ArrayFields collections.
The following is a list of common form commands:
client
branch
label
job
user
group
protect
triggers
branch
When fetching or saving a form, do not use the '-o' and '-i' flags. P4.Net will automatically include them.
member.returns: P4UnParsedRecordSet. Output can be parsed to verify the form was processed correctly.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Save_Form(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the form to Perforce.
member.returns: P4UnParsedRecordSet. Output can be parsed to verify the form was processed correctly.

member.summary: Saves the form to Perforce.
member.param: True to pass the '-f' flag when saving.
member.returns: P4UnParsedRecordSet. Output can be parsed to verify the form was processed correctly.

member.summary: Saves the form to Perforce.
member.param: The P4Form object retrieved from Fetch_Form.
True to pass the '-f' flag when saving.
member.remarks:
Forms are the things that pop-up in an editor when run from a command line. In P4.Net (and most other Perforce APIs), you do not need to parse/format the text manually. Instead, you can get/set the fields using the Fields and ArrayFields collections.
The following is a list of common form commands:
client
branch
label
job
user

protect
triggers

When fetching or saving a form, do not use the '-o' and '-i' flags. P4.Net will automatically include them.
member.returns: P4UnParsedRecordSet. Output can be parsed to verify the form was processed correctly.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.PrintBinary(System.String)
member.summary: Print the contents of a file in Perforce to a byte array.
member.returns: Contents of the file. Text files will be encoded with ANSI encodinge. Unicode files will be encoded as UTF-8 (regardless of P4CHARSET setting).

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.PrintText(System.String)
member.summary: Print the contents of a file in Perforce to a string.
member.returns: Contents of the file.
member.remarks:
Attempting to call PrintText on a binary file will likely cause corruption.
If a file is does not exist, a FileNotFound exception will be thrown (regardless of the ExceptionLevel setting).
Depot Path, Client Path or Local Path can generally be used for the argument depotPath (so long as the argument is valid for the p4 print command line.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.PrintStream(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Prints the contents of a Perforce file to a Stream.
member.param: Writable stream to write the contents to.
Perforce path of the file to print.
member.remarks:
If a file is does not exist, a FileNotFound exception will be thrown (regardless of the ExceptionLevel setting).
Depot Path, Client Path or Local Path can generally be used for the argument depotPath (so long as the argument is valid for the p4 print command line.
Encoding will only be applied to files with a Perforce type of 'text' or 'unicode'.
The stream argument can be any valid stream, so long as it is initialized and writable.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.PrintStream(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Prints the contents of a Perforce file to a Stream.
member.param: Writable stream to write the contents to.
Perforce path of the file to print.
member.remarks:
If a file is does not exist, a FileNotFound exception will be thrown (regardless of the ExceptionLevel setting).
Depot Path, Client Path or Local Path can generally be used for the argument depotPath (so long as the argument is valid for the p4 print command line.
The stream argument can be any valid stream, so long as it is initialized and writable.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.PrintStreamEvents(System.String[])
member.summary: Runs a print command, and raises events for each file printed.
member.param: Arguments to the p4 print command.
member.remarks: This method is useful when you need to print several files with a single call to the Perforce server.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Connection.Dispose
member.summary: Calls Disconnect.

member.name: E:P4API.P4Connection.OnPrompt
member.summary: Raised when Perforce is prompting for a response.
member.remarks:
Handle Perforce "prompts". Prompts are from commands that ask the user to respond, such as:
login
passwd
resolve (without an -a* switch)

member.name: E:P4API.P4Connection.OnPrintStream
member.summary: Raised from P4PrintStreamEvents before a file is printed.
member.remarks: Handle this event to initialize a stream that P4API will write to.

member.name: E:P4API.P4Connection.OnPrintEndFile
member.summary: Raised from P4PrintStreamEvents after a file is printed.
member.remarks: Use this event to close any streams that were created by the OnPrintStreamEventHandler event.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.MaxScanRows
member.summary: Gets/Sets a value that overrides the defined MaxScanRows.
member.remarks: Servers may set a limit for MaxScanRows for certain users. Set this value to override. A value of 0 indicates no override.
member.value: Overrides the MaxScanRows defined at the server.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.MaxLockTime
member.summary: Gets/Sets a value that overrides the defined MaxLockTime.
member.remarks: Servers may set a limit for MaxLockTime for certain users. Set this value to override. A value of 0 indicates no override.
member.value: Overrides the MaxLockTime defined at the server.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.MaxResults
member.summary: Gets/Sets a value that overrides the defined MaxResults.
member.remarks: Servers may set a limit for MaxResults for certain users. Set this value to override. A value of 0 indicates no override.
member.value: Overrides the MaxResults defined at the server.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.Host
member.summary: Gets/Sets the Host-name of the client.
member.remarks: Forcing the Host to a different name is useful when using a client that was defined on a different host. Of course, that can cause issues with the client's have list, so use with caution.
member.value: The client Host name.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.Port
member.summary: Gets/Sets the Perforce Server port.
member.value: The port.
member.remarks: Defaults to the value set in your Perforce environment. Port can not be changed after running Connect (not even after a Disconnect). To connect to a server on another port, create a new instance of P4Connection.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.User
member.summary: Gets/Sets the User login used to connect to Perforce.
member.value: The user.
member.remarks: Defaults to the value set in your Perforce environment. After you've set User, you can unset (revert to the default) by setting to User to null.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.Charset
member.summary: Gets/Sets the client character set.
member.remarks: Defaults to the value set in your Perforce environment. After you've set Charset, you can unset (revert to the default) by setting to Charset to null.
member.value: The client's charset.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.CallingProgram
member.summary: Get/Sets the name of the calling program.
member.remarks: This value is seen in p4 monitor and in the server log files.
member.value: Defaults to "P4.Net API".

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.CallingVersion
member.summary: Gets/Sets the version of the calling program's version.
member.remarks: This value is seen in p4 monitor and the server log files.
member.value: Defaults to the assembly version of the P4API.dll.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.Password
member.summary: Sets the password to conenct with.
member.remarks: Do not set the literal password with a server running security level 2 or higher. For those servers, Use the Login method and/or a ticket in place of the Password.
member.value: The user's password.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.TicketFile
member.summary: Sets the ticket file used for Authentication.
member.remarks: Use this to override the default location of the TicketFile.
member.value: Overrided the ticket file location.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.Client
member.summary: Gets/Sets the client workspace.
member.remarks: Many Perforce commands require a valid client spec to be set in order to run. Defaults to the value set in your Perforce environment. After you've set Client, you can unset (revert to the default) by setting to Client to null.
member.value: The client name.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.CWD
member.summary: Gets/Sets the current working directory.
member.remarks: Setting CWD can be used so that relative paths are specified. Keep in mind that changing the CWD also might cause P4CONFIG settings to change.
member.value: The current working directory for the Perforce connection.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.Api
member.summary: Sets the client API protocol level.
member.remarks:
Sets the API compatibility level desired. This is useful when writing scripts using Perforce commands that do not yet support tagged output. In these cases, upgrading to a later server that supports tagged output for the commands in question can break your script. Using this method allows you to lock your script to the output format of an older Perforce release and facilitate seamless upgrades. Note that this method must be called prior to calling Connect.
See the http://kb.perforce.com/P4dServerReference/ProtocolLevels/PerforceClientLevels for the API integer levels that correspond to each Perforce release.
member.value: The Perforce API level.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.ExceptionLevel
member.summary: Gets/Sets the Exception level when running Perforce commands.

remarks.para: This property controls when P4.Net will throw exceptions when the underlying Perforce commands raise errors and warnings.

member.value: The exception level for the connection.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Connection.ServerLevel
member.summary: Checks the server level (version) of the Perforce server.
member.returns: The server's version level.
member.remarks: See http://kb.perforce.com/P4dServerReference/ProtocolLevels/PerforceServerLevels for more informantion.
member.value: The server's version level.

member.name: T:P4API.P4Form
member.summary: Represents a Perforce 'Form' object.
member.remarks:
Forms are the things that pop-up in an editor when run from a command line. In P4.Net (and most other Perforce APIs), you do not need to parse/format the text manually. Instead, you can get/set the fields using the Fields and ArrayFields collections.
The following is a list of common form commands:
client
branch
label
job
user
group
protect
triggers
branch
When fetching or saving a form, do not use the '-o' and '-i' flags. P4.Net will automatically include them.

member.name: T:P4API.P4Record
member.summary: P4Record is a dictionary-like object that provides a means of interpreting Perforce results.
member.remarks:
The Perforce api provides "parsed" output in the form of key-value pairs. Keys are always strings (case sensitive). From the raw api, the values come in 3 flavors:
Simple strings.
List of strings.
Sparse multi-demensional list of strings.
P4.Net does not yet handle the third type (which only comes from certain output of p4 filelog).
To access simple string values by key, use the Fields property (or the default indexer).
To access lists of strings by key, use the ArrayFields property.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Record.Fields
member.summary: Gets the FieldDictionary returned from the Perforce command.
member.value: The single-value fields returned for the current record.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Record.ArrayFields
member.summary: Gets the ArrayFieldDictionary returned from the Perforce command.
member.value: The array-value fields returned for the current record.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Record.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of of the Field by key. This is the same as Fields[key].
member.returns: String value for the associated key.
member.value: The value for field 'key'.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Form.LoadFromSpec(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Parses a Perforce form without making a server connection.
member.param: The command that would otherwise be used to fetch the form.
member.returns: A Perforce form object.
member.remarks: LoadFromSpec can be used to parse a form without making a call to the server. LoadFromSpec can be useful in form triggers. It does require you to know the SpecDef to call, which can change when upgrading or changing the server configuration.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Form.FormatSpec
member.summary: Formats the P4Form as a formated Perforce spec.
member.returns: String of the formated form spec.

member.name: M:P4API.P4Form.Clone
member.summary: Copies the P4Form object into a new instance.
member.returns: A copy of the P4Form object.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Form.FormCommand
member.summary: Gets the form command.
member.value: The command that was executed when the form was run.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Form.PermittedFields
member.summary: Gets a StringCollection containing the names of all the allowable fields in the form.
member.remarks: The fields returned by PermittedFields are not necessarily included in Fields.Keys or ArrayFields.Keys. Perforce forms usually do not have keys for empty values.
member.value: StringCollection containing the names of all the allowable fields in the form.

member.name: P:P4API.P4Form.SpecDef
member.summary: The underlying C++ API 'specdef' defining the form.
member.value: The C++ 'specdef' that defines the format of the spec.
member.remarks: The SpecDef is a formatted string that Perforce uses internally to parse forms. SpecDefs will vary by form, server version, and even with specific server configurations. In general, you should avoid using a SpecDef directly; however, in some cases you can avoid a server call by using the SpecDef.

member.name: T:P4API.P4PendingChangelist
member.summary: Represents a pending changelist from Perforce.
member.remarks:
The P4PendindingChangelist object is used to submit files with P4.Net. The first step is to create a new pending changelist, then add the switches "-c", and "1234" (1234 is the changelist number) to all commands that are opening files.
In P4.Net, there’s no straight-forward way to submit the default pending changelist. This is by design. If the client workspace has opened files in the default changelist before any P4.Net automation runs, those files will "come along for the ride" when you submit the default changelist. If the user has a JobView set, all jobs in that JobView will automatically be fixed when you submit the default changelist. Both of those behaviors are almost never desired, and I’ve found many scripts that have those bugs.

member.name: M:P4API.P4PendingChangelist.Submit
member.summary: Submits the pending changelist to Perforce.
member.returns: P4UnParsedRecordSet with the results of the submit.

member.name: P:P4API.P4PendingChangelist.Number
member.summary: Gets the pending changelist's number.
member.value: The changelist number.

member.name: P:P4API.P4PendingChangelist.Description
member.summary: Gets the pending changelist's description.
member.value: The description.

member.name: T:P4API.P4RecordSet
member.summary: Provides output of a Perforce Command in "tagged" moded.

member.name: T:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary
member.summary: Strongly typed dictionary to represent array-valued fields returned from Perforce commands.
member.remarks:
The FieldDictionary only contains fields that contain a string array values. Fields that return a single string values are stored in .
If a value is read from a key that does not exist, an empty array will be returned. If a value is set with a key that does not exist, it will automatically be added. This behavior is to support many Perforce commands that omit a key, rather than supply a default value.

member.name: M:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary.Clear
member.summary: Clears all elements of the dictionary.

member.name: M:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if the key exists in the dictionary.
member.returns: True if the key is defined in the dictionary.

member.name: M:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes elements from the dictionary.
member.param: The key of the element to remove.

member.name: P:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary.Keys
member.summary: Gets all keys contained in the dictionary.
member.value: Keys in the ArrayFieldDictionary.

member.name: P:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements in the dictionary
member.value: Number of items.

member.name: P:P4API.ArrayFieldDictionary.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value assocatied to the key.
member.returns: String array value associated to the key.
